articles.author: Sky
articles.title: COVID-19: South Asian people faced greater risk than others in England during second wave - Sky News
articles.description: Body weight, blood pressure, underlying conditions and even household size could be some of the key drivers, scientists say.

articles.title: South Asians In UK At Greater Risk In Second Covid Wave: Study - NDTV
articles.description: Minority ethnic groups in general and South Asians, in particular, had a higher risk of testing positive for SARS-CoV-2 and of COVID-19 related hospitalisations, ICU admissions, deaths during the second wave in UK, according to a new study.
articles.content:
The study accounted for a number of explanatory variables such as household size, social factors. (File)
